originalTitle: Can Trump still impose tariffs after the Supreme Court ruling?
title: Mr. Trump, Toys, and Wise Judges!
content:
Hello, Little Explorers!

Hello, wonderful friends in Africa! It's your friendly news reporter here. Today, we're going on an adventure. We will learn about big important things. These things happen far away. Sometimes, grown-ups make rules that sound tricky. But we can learn them together! We're going to talk about a leader. His name is Mr. Trump. We will also talk about special payments. They are called 'tariffs.' And we will learn about some very wise judges. It sounds like a lot, but don't worry! We will make it fun and easy to understand.

Who is Mr. Trump?

Imagine your school has a head teacher, right? And your town has a mayor or chief? Well, big countries have a very important leader. He is called a President. Mr. Trump used to be the President. He was the boss of a very big country far away. It is called the United States of America. He was in charge of making many rules. He worked to help his country. Just like your teachers help your school. Or your parents help your family. Did you know? There are many presidents in Africa too! Each country in Africa has its own special leader.

What are "Tariffs"? (Like a Special Toy Tax!)

Now, let's talk about something called "tariffs." It's a funny word. But it's not too hard to understand. Imagine you love your toy cars. Or your building blocks. What if those toys come from another country? When those toys came into Mr. Trump's country, he wanted to make a special rule. He wanted to say, "Before these toys can come in, the people selling them must pay a little extra money!" This extra money has a special name. It is called a "tariff." It's like a special entrance fee for things coming from other places. Why would he want this? Let's find out! Did you know? People all over the world buy and sell things to each other. This is called 'trade'! It's like when you swap a snack with your friend, but much, much bigger!

Why Would Someone Want Tariffs?

Mr. Trump thought this: If other countries paid extra money for their toys, then people in his country would buy toys made in his country. This would help people who make toys there. He wanted to help the people who make toys in his own country. And other things too. He thought it would make their businesses stronger. And it would create more jobs for his people. It’s like if your friend sells delicious biscuits. And someone else brings biscuits from far away. If the faraway biscuits cost extra, you might buy your friend's biscuits instead. That would help your friend! That’s a bit like what Mr. Trump was trying to do. He wanted to help his country's toy makers and other workers. Did you know? Countries often make things that other countries need. Like delicious fruits, cool clothes, or even computers!

What Did the Wise Judges Do? (The Supreme Court!)

So, Mr. Trump had this idea for special payments. These were the "tariffs." But sometimes, when leaders make big rules, other very smart people need to check them. These very smart people are called judges. In Mr. Trump's country, the most important judges are in a place called the Supreme Court. They are super important! The Supreme Court judges are like super referees. They check all the big rules. They make sure the rules are fair. And they make sure the rules follow the country's main rule book. In this story, Mr. Trump wanted to make some tariff rules very quickly. He wanted to use a special way. But some other people said, "Wait, is this the right way to make these rules?" The wise judges looked at the rules very carefully. They thought about it deeply. Just like when you need to solve a tricky puzzle. And they made a big decision! They said, "Mr. Trump, you cannot make these specific tariff rules in *that* particular quick way." It was like they said, "You need to make these rules in a different way." This was a big deal. It was the first time these wise judges said "no" to one of Mr. Trump's big plans about tariffs. Did you know? In many African countries, there are also wise judges. They work in special courts. They make sure everyone follows the rules fairly!

What Happens Next?

So, the wise judges said "no" to that *one way* of making the tariff rules. Does this mean Mr. Trump cannot make any rules about things coming into his country anymore? No, not at all! It just means he has to find other ways. Imagine you want to build a tall tower with blocks. You try one way, but it keeps falling down. Does that mean you can't build a tower? No! It means you have to try a different way. Maybe use different blocks. Or a different design. It's the same for Mr. Trump. Or any leader. Even though the wise judges said "no" to one specific way of making tariff rules, he (or future leaders) can still think of other ways. They can make rules about buying and selling things with other countries. There are many paths to help a country. Leaders often try different ideas to find the best one. Did you know? Learning from mistakes or challenges is how we all grow. Even big leaders!

Why Is This Important?

This story is important because it shows us a few things: 1. **Even leaders have rules to follow:** Just like you have rules at home and school, leaders also have big rules (called laws) they must follow. 2. **Wise judges help keep things fair:** The Supreme Court judges are there to make sure everyone follows the rules in a fair way. This includes the President! This helps everyone in the country. 3. **Leaders keep trying:** If one plan does not work, leaders try to find another way. They keep trying to help their country. It's a wonderful example of how countries work. There are leaders. There are rules. And there are wise people to help make sure everything runs smoothly for everyone. And now you know a little bit more about how big countries manage their buying and selling! Did you know? When countries work together, they can often help each other grow and share wonderful things!

Let's Learn Together!

We learned about Mr. Trump, special payments called tariffs, and the super wise Supreme Court judges. You did a great job learning about these big ideas! Keep being curious and asking questions. That's how we all learn and grow!
summary: Mr. Trump, a former President, wanted to make special payments called tariffs for goods from other countries, but wise judges in the Supreme Court said he needed to find a different way to make those rules.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows that even presidents must follow rules, and wise judges help make sure everyone, even leaders, acts fairly for all the people in a country.

title: Mourinho made 'unacceptable, huge mistake' - Kompany

originalTitle: Ratcliffe avoids FA charge over immigration comments
title: Ratcliffe avoids FA charge over immigration comments
content: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe's claims the UK has been "colonised by immigrants" will not lead to any sanction by the Football Association.
